body: using `decay` often, need this feature too

I can't really seem to find the point in where those parameters were dropped in the commit history... much as like they were meant to be, they were documented as they should have worked... but heh... never actually implemented those :)

@w4nderlust: this would have been obvious if there was such a "unknown parameter" warning\error in the yaml parsing, just to reference another use case for https://github.com/uber/ludwig/issues/822#issuecomment-674425054

rename.from: decay, decay_rate and decay_steps still in use?
rename.to: decay, decay_rate and decay_steps not implemented

body: Only references to `decay` in all the codebase are the default parameters. I can't find any other reference for the parameters in the subject.
This is weird, I have to go back in time to see what happened to these parameters. Thank you for posting this.

Indeed... And it's not TF2 fault, since a year ago they still aren't there.

Thanks
@w4nderlust I noticed that you replaced TF2 with the `master` branch and this affected a lot of commits. Don't know how. When I was switching back to TF1 I needed to use my own branch inside the fork
It was inside the deleted file

This actually helped me rememeber: in TF1 ther was this exponential decay function i was using, inf TF2 thigns work differently, now I'm adding a todo before the release of v0.3 to re-enable the exponencial decay logic. Thank you for noticing this guys, it's great to release the alpha version and having members of the community spotting these things, will make the v0.3 the most robust version yet :)
#898 solves this. Let me know if it's not ok.

I am finally able to test decay and decay_rate, but it seems that the learning rate reduction due to decay is only applied one time, and then never again

ie: I set LR to 0.1, decay to true, decay_rate to 0.9 and LR goes down to 0.09986 after the first epoch and then stays that way forever

Can you check this? Do you prefer to have a new issue opened?

Thanks

So this is kinda weird. inspecting this I figured out some issues with the way the learning rate is computed. I'm fixing them, but yours is different. Also, changing the reporting of the learning rate per batch, as the decay (and the warm up) ar applead on a per batch basis.
Will probably put up a PR soonfor you to try.

issue.title: Fix learning rate computation with decay and warmup
issue.body:
Fixes the place where the lr computation is done and some parameters.
Fix #839 

Now this happens without warmup and decay:
![nothing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513485-a961d480-1949-11eb-8bfc-ac898d6cb6d9.png)

This when warmup is on
![warmup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513499-b1217900-1949-11eb-8be1-b7334eb37f2f.png)

This when decay is on
![decay](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513520-bb437780-1949-11eb-900f-25121bffaee7.png)

This when decay with staircase is on
![decay_staircase](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513534-c4ccdf80-1949-11eb-9df0-cd1aa86ee103.png)

And these wen warmup and decay are on at the same time
![warmup_decay](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513554-cf877480-1949-11eb-8be3-296fd1edafad.png)
![warmup_decay_staircase](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513558-d1e9ce80-1949-11eb-9ad8-9ad4ee2536b7.png)

body:
Allright, this is the new behavior after the fixes.

Fixes the place where the lr computation is done and some parameters.

Now this happens without warmup and decay:
![nothing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513485-a961d480-1949-11eb-8bfc-ac898d6cb6d9.png)

This when warmup is on
![warmup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513499-b1217900-1949-11eb-8be1-b7334eb37f2f.png)

This when decay is on
![decay](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513520-bb437780-1949-11eb-900f-25121bffaee7.png)

This when decay with staircase is on
![decay_staircase](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513534-c4ccdf80-1949-11eb-9df0-cd1aa86ee103.png)

And these wen warmup and decay are on at the same time
![warmup_decay](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513554-cf877480-1949-11eb-8be3-296fd1edafad.png)
![warmup_decay_staircase](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/349256/97513558-d1e9ce80-1949-11eb-9ad8-9ad4ee2536b7.png)

Looks reasonable to me :) can you doublecheck with your usecase please?

That looks good from your comment, will try and see today.
Warmup was already okay, I don't understand if you found some more issues there or if was just an FYI mentioning warmup also.

There's only the first graph that is suspiciously aligned with 0, and I noted that it happens when the LR is waaaay too low, and maybe there are some precision/rounding mechanisms that set it to zero in the graphs (I think we can more than live with it, since it only applies to the first few epochs in a warmup use case, and never happened in the latter part of the training, since it should have gone down to non usable LR values).

Will report back :)

I had a weird feedback, like that warmup was always set to 10, but this is due to the fact that i have mistaken step_learning_rate for epoch_learning_rate.

It is all correct and working fine!

In the first graph, I guess the range set by the tensorboard doesn't allow to see it was actually a 0.01 learning rate, but i manually checked, and the 0.01 just stayed constant throughout.

Glad this worked, merging the PR and closing.
